definition: and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge

sentences.english: Colleen would urge her sister to join her in bed. As they sat up in bed side by side, holding hands, Colleen and her sister would “just talk.”
sentences.chinese: 當她們姐妹在牀上肩並肩手挽手地坐着她們都會聊天。

sentences.english: The first set is side by side.
sentences.chinese: 第一組是肩並肩的一對圓。

sentences.english: I went through alcoholism treatment with Rielly.
sentences.chinese: 我和裏利一起，肩並肩，終於挺過了酗酒治療。

sentences.english: We jammed together, shoulder-to-shoulder, in the narrow confines.
sentences.chinese: 在有限的空間裏，我們緊緊擠在一起，肩並肩。

sentences.english: Prudence opened a window and we leaned on our elbows side by side on the balcony.
sentences.chinese: 普律當絲打開一扇窗子，我們肩並肩地倚在陽臺上。

sentences.english: Shoulder to shoulder, hand in hand, and complete your life journey.
sentences.chinese: 肩並肩，手挽手，共同走完這段人生路。

sentences.english: The students stood side by side for the class photo.
sentences.chinese: 學生們肩並肩地站好全班照相。

sentences.english: Remember we had, shoulder to shoulder together, that busy lane that has.
sentences.chinese: 還記得我們曾經，肩並肩一起走過，那段繁華巷口。

sentences.english: They embraced and walked away side by side.
sentences.chinese: 他們擁抱着，肩並肩離開了。

sentences.english: Side by side, the two teenagers traversed the mysteries of the silent woods.
sentences.chinese: 兩位青年肩並肩地橫穿過寂寥無聲的神祕森林。
部隊肩並肩地齊步前進。

sentences.english: We sat side by side, then went to the foyer.
sentences.chinese: 我們肩並肩地坐着，然後去了休息室。

definition: lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
lit. single spear and horse (idiom); fig. single-handed/unaccompanied

pinyin: Xi3 ma3 la1 ya3 shan1 mai4

definition: lit. the cycle comes back to the start (idiom); to move in circles/the wheel comes full circle
(bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
to get ready (for a journey)/ready and waiting
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
to bridge/to put up a bridge
